summary: This bill, S. 2468, introduced in the U.S. Senate, aims to amend Section 249 of the Immigration and Nationality Act. It focuses on adjusting the criteria for eligibility for long-term residents to apply for registry, potentially allowing them to obtain legal status. The bill removes specific entry dates from the section header and modifies the requirements for application, specifically concerning the length of time residing in the United States before the application date. The changes will take effect 60 days after enactment.
